content.raw: `_GAZEBO_`
Shouldn't these be deprecated first? I can imagine a lot of people are using these directly.
content.html: Shouldn't these be deprecated first? I can imagine a lot of people are using these directly.

content.raw: I guess it is not possible to have 2 variables of different types with the same name. Not sure what's the proper way to go about this, I think we shouldn't have public variables to begin with. How about keeping these as `gazebo::math` and deprecate them on Gazebo6, and at the same time add private `ignition::math` variables with accessors? If we pimplize this class, the new variables could be `this->dataPtr->pos` and the names wouldn't collide.
content.html: I guess it is not possible to have 2 variables of different types with the same name. Not sure what's the proper way to go about this, I think we shouldn't have public variables to begin with. How about keeping these as gazebo::math and deprecate them on Gazebo6, and at the same time add private ignition::math variables with accessors? If we pimplize this class, the new variables could be this->dataPtr->pos and the names wouldn't collide.

content.raw:
This would be difficult because there would be no compile time warning about the variables being deprecated. We also can write code that conditionally uses a variable or a function without the user specifying some kind of flag at runtime.

PIMPLizing this class is a good idea, the caveat is that users will still face the same migration problem.
content.html:
This would be difficult because there would be no compile time warning about the variables being deprecated. We also can write code that conditionally uses a variable or a function without the user specifying some kind of flag at runtime.

PIMPLizing this class is a good idea, the caveat is that users will still face the same migration problem.
